definitions.definition: An area ; somewhere within an area .

subdefinitions.definition: An open space , particularly a city square , market square , or courtyard .
A street, sometimes but not always surrounding a public place, square , or plaza of the same name.
labels: often in street names or addresses
subdefinitions.label_groups: often in street names or addresses

subdefinitions.definition: An inhabited area : a village , town , or city .
Any area of the earth : a region .
examples: He is going back to his native place on vacation.

subdefinitions.definition: The area one occupies , particularly somewhere to sit .
examples: We asked the restaurant to give us a table with three places .

subdefinitions.definition: The area where one lives : one 's home , formerly ( chiefly ) country estates and farms .
examples: Do you want to come over to my place later?

subdefinitions.definition: An area of the body, especially the skin .
An area to urinate and defecate : an outhouse or lavatory .
An area to fight : a battlefield or the contested ground in a battle .

definitions.definition: A location or position in space .
A particular location in a book or document , particularly the current location of a reader
examples: I lost my place when you interrupted me.

definitions.definition: A passage or extract from a book or document .

examples: I'm in a strange place at the moment.

definitions.definition: A chess position ; a square of the chessboard .
A responsibility or position in an organization .

subdefinitions.definition: A role or purpose ; a station .
examples: It is really not my place to say what is right and wrong in this case.

subdefinitions.definition: The position of a contestant in a competition .
examples: We thought we would win but only ended up in fourth place .

subdefinitions.definition: The position of first, second, or third at the finish, especially the second position.
examples: to win a bet on a horse for place

subdefinitions.definition: The position as a member of a sports team .
examples: He lost his place in the national team.

definitions.definition: A fortified position : a fortress , citadel , or walled town .
Numerically, the column counting a certain quantity.
examples: three decimal places ;  the hundreds place

definitions.definition: Ordinal relation; position in the order of proceeding.
examples: That's what I said in the first place !

definitions.definition: Reception; effect; implying the making room for.

main_definition: ( physical ) An area ; somewhere within an area .
secondary_definitions: A location or position in space .
A particular location in a book or document , particularly the current location of a reader
( obsolete ) A passage or extract from a book or document .
( chess , obsolete ) A chess position ; a square of the chessboard .
( social ) A responsibility or position in an organization .
( obsolete ) A fortified position : a fortress , citadel , or walled town .
Numerically, the column counting a certain quantity.
Ordinal relation; position in the order of proceeding.
Reception; effect; implying the making room for.
